content:
theres good news and then theres bad news for the Colorado Buffaloes womens golf team PERIOD

The bad news is CU shot  over par to finish ninth out of  teams at the CSU PtarmiganRam Fall Classic in Fort Collins on Tuesday PERIOD But thats the extent of the negativity PERIOD

The good news is they improved their performance after finishing dead last at the NGCA Collegiate Match Play Championship last week PERIOD

I am proud of the overall finish considering we got off to a pretty rough start this morning head coach Anne Kelly said in a news release PERIOD I see signs of better play and performances but we still have some work to do and we just need to continue to play better than we have been. redshirt freshman Taylor Doyle shot 2under for a careerbest score of  on Tuesday asDoyle completed her firstever tournament as a Buff PERIOD She improved from fifty-seventh to thirty-fifth in the tourneys individual standings after recording a teamworst  in two rounds Monday PERIOD

I have been really nervous Doyle said in a news release PERIOD I didnt get any experience last year but I worked a lot in tournaments this summer and I felt ready and a lot less nervous. i think that Ive adjusted well PERIOD So far so good PERIOD

I was a lot more comfortable with what shots I was hitting this round Doyle said.In my first two rounds things werent working together and I would hit a great shot but miss the putt PERIOD Today I hit both the great shots and great putts PERIOD It wasnt that anything changed but instead everything was just working. sophomore Emily Talley led CU with a  total in the twoday tourney to place seventeenth PERIOD Senior Dominique Pytlewski finished one stroke behind Talley PERIOD

CSUthe host of the tournament finished second four strokes behind Idaho PERIOD

The Buffs next tournament will be next Saturday and Sunday at the UNM Branch Law FirmDick McGuire Invitational in Albuquerque N.M PERIOD

Contact CU Independent Sports Editor Cheng Sio at Cheng.siocolorado.edu PERIOD
